intro: Humularia tenuis, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a small herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. Humularia tenuis is often overlooked due to its modest appearance but plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
